speaker: WOMAN
line: Auntie Janet? It’s time, Auntie Janet. He’s waiting. The two women go outside toward the minivan. They enter it. A man is inside.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We should hurry. We have papers to sign. Just tell me when.

speaker: AUNTIE JANET
line: Don’t you cry for me, dear. I’m tired of the pain. You’re my angel of mercy.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Is she gone?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Something’s wrong here. .

speaker: MESSENGER
line: Vassily Peskow?

speaker: PESKOW

speaker: MESSENGER

speaker: PRISONER
line: Prisoner? Hey Prisoner. . I thought maybe you were dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long have I been lying here?

speaker: PRISONER
line: Hours...I don’t know. The first time is bad.

speaker: MULDER
line: They’ve done this to you?

speaker: PRISONER
line: Yes. It becomes easier each time....until it kills you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did they do to me.

speaker: PRISONER
line: You have been exposed to the Black Cancer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Black Cancer?

speaker: PRISONER
line: The cancer that lives in the rock.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: PRISONER
line: I was a geologist....quite well known actually...but now I am just a test subject.

speaker: MULDER
line: You helped them find the rock?

speaker: PRISONER
line: I was there when they brought up the first fragments. This was before the mining....before we knew what lived in Tunguska Rock...

speaker: MULDER
line: How many men have dies here?

speaker: PRISONER
line: Hundreds...maybe more...The search for a cure goes slowly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what they say the tests are for...to find a cure?

speaker: PRISONER
line: No...they tell us nothing...We are left to guess and imagine the reasons for out torture....But, what else could it be?

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to the man who was in the cell with me, Krycek?

speaker: PRISONER
line: He is most likely dining with the men responsible for our torture... I heard laughter when they left your cell.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not going to die...

speaker: PRISONER
line: Why not?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have to live long enough to kill that man, Krycek. Where did you get this?

speaker: PRISONER
line: I made it...to kill myself....It took me two weeks- by then I had lost the desire.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’d rather suffer the torture?

speaker: PRISONER
line: It is wonderful- the persistence of life. That rock we found buried so deep in the Earth- that ANYTHING could survive down there goes beyond all reason...No. They will have to kill me themselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We haven’t been able to give him anything but fluids for over forty-eight hours.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Well, it doesn’t help that he’s in a restricted environment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if he has been infected by some kind of organism we risk contamination...Are you seeing anything?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: The blood in the carotid artery looks slightly thickened...Possibly due to the decreased heart rate and blood pressure....Now what’s this? What the hell is this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: I don’t know...It looks like its concentrated around his pineal body...I think its alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like a nest....some type of black vermiform organism attached to the pineal gland.

speaker: PESKOW
line: Apple?

speaker: WOMAN 2
line: No. Thank you very much though. Peskow boards the bus. The destination sign changes from Richmond to Charlottesville.

speaker: PESKOW
line: Oh, pardon me.

speaker: DR. CHARNE-SAYER
line: Who are you?

speaker: PESKOW
line: As a boy, my father had a farm....not horses like these. My name is Vassily Peskow.

speaker: DR. CHARNE-SAYER
line: Mr. Peskow...I’m sorry, but you don’t belong in here.

speaker: PESKOW
line: I am sorry, very sorry.

speaker: DR. CHARNE-SAYER
line: You are going to have to leave here. I’m going to call you a cab.

speaker: PESKOW
line: But I have come here to see you, Dr. Charne-Sayre.

speaker: DR. CHARNE-SAYRE
line: Do I know you?

speaker: PESKOW
line: No...I don’t know how you could.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir...what are you...

speaker: SKINNER
line: I’ve been trying to contact you for hours...The better part of the day.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m sorry sir, my cell phone was turned off.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You owe me some answers, Agent Scully. Answers I don’t have to the questions I’m being asked about this missing diplomatic pouch. The pouch presumably being carried by the man who was allegedly pushed off my balcony, and whose connection to a known felon I harbored in my house against all good sense, I’m going to have to explain to avoid perjuring myself before a Senate sub-committee tomorrow. Which, I might remind you, is a very serious crime in itself. Is it not, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes Sir. Sir, if I might explain...the contents of that pouch...it contained some sort of a biohazardous organism that is, luckily, being contained in a contamination laboratory at NASA Goddard, where I’ve been all day trying to determine its exact nature.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That pouch you intercepted. Do you know what its intended destination was?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No sir, I don’t.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, I do, Agent Scully, because I bent some rules this morning when I couldn’t find you. To find out who was to receive it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who was it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Bonita Charne-Sayre. Are you familiar with that name?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes sir, I am...She’s a well-know physician....and a...a virologist who’s looked in on presidents. She’s also an authority on...on variola viruses.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Variola?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Smallpox....She’s been a vocal proponent of eliminating the last remaining stores of the Smallpox virus....destroying the only remaining vials in facilities here in Atlanta and the former Soviet Union.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, she was killed tonight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Killed?

speaker: SKINNER
line: A horse stepped on her throat in a riding accident in Virginia.

speaker: GUARD
line: nan

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are we going?

line: Prisoner.....Is that your friend? You have but one chance.

speaker: GUARD

speaker: MULDER

speaker: CSM
line: That’s a nasty habit...bad for the health.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Health is the least of my concerns at the moment.

speaker: CSM
line: Yes. According to reports your....personal physician suffered a serious riding accident here on your property.

speaker: WMM
line: Dr. Charne-Sayre was murdered.

speaker: CSM
line: By whom?

speaker: WMM
line: If I knew, do you think I’d be standing here talking to you?

speaker: CSM
line: Oh....you need me now...A man of my capabilities...is that it?

speaker: WMM
line: This was a professional hit.

speaker: CSM
line: And you out here all alone...so vulnerable...Were you sleeping with her? Surely you wouldn’t be so foolish as to put the project at risk for the sake of your personal pleasures.

speaker: WMM
line: Find her killer!

speaker: CSM
line: Call off this Congressional investigation.

speaker: WMM
line: I can’t. But, Senator Sorenson is an honorable man. They are all honorable...these Honorable men

speaker: CSM
line: I heard Mulder was captured in Tunguska. I hear now he’s escaped. Wake the Russian Bear and it may find we’ve stolen its honey.

speaker: FIRST MAN

speaker: SCULLY
line: I Dana Katherine Scully swear to tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth, so help me so help me God. I would like to read from a prepared statement.

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: You may do so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I left behind a career in medicine to become an FBI agent four years ago because I believed in this country. because I wanted to uphold its laws, to punish the guilty and to protect the innocent. I still believe in this country, but I believe that there are powerful men in this government who do not ....men who have no respect for the law, and who flout it with impunity.

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: Uh...Miss Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have come to the conclusion....

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ...that it is no longer possible...

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: This is not a soapbox Miss Scully. Your statement will be entered into the record.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With all due respect Mr. Chairman, I would like to finish.

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: This is NOT why we are here today.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why are we here, sir?

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Agent Scully, do you or do you not know the whereabouts of Agent Mulder? Are you, or are you not aware of Agent Mulder’s present location?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I respectfully refuse to answer that question, sir, because...

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: Agent Scully, you cannot refuse to answer that question.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because I believe that answering that question could endanger Agent Mulder’s life.

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: You don’t seem to understand. Your response is not optional. You are an agent of the FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then if I may please finish my statement......that it is no longer possible for me to carry out my duties as an FBI agent.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Are you tendering your resignation, Agent Scully. Is that what you’re trying to say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. What I am saying, is that there is a culture of lawlessness that has prevented me from doing my job- that the real target of this committee’s investigation should be the men who are beyond prosecution and punishment....the men whose secret policies are behind the crimes that you are investigating.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: You have a legal obligation to answer the questions posed to you. Now....either you tell us what you know about Agent Mulder’s whereabouts, or you’ll be held in contempt of Congress.

speaker: SCENE
line: Scully is being led down a white hallway by a U.S. Marshall. She is led to a cell and locked inside.

line: No Russian.

speaker: WIFE
line: American?

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell your husband I’m sorry about his truck.

speaker: WIFE
line: The test!?!

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: WIFE
line: They kill everybody for the test.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don’t they kill you?

speaker: WIFE
line: My husband makes deliveries. They spare our lives. But now...no truck... he is afraid.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I have to go now.

speaker: WIFE
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: They’ll come looking for me. They’ll come looking for you.

speaker: WIFE
line: No. There are other ways.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know what you’re talking about. What other ways?

speaker: WIFE
line: Grisha! No arm. No test.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t understand...these tests. The smallpox scar on your arm is some kind of identification. You have to help me escape. I’ll help you escape. You have to help me get to St. Petersburg.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You holding up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve got plenty to read.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can understand you protecting Agent Mulder but...

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s not just Agent Mulder that I am protecting, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then what are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were called before this committee to answer questions about a murder- about an intercepted diplomatic pouch- a pouch that was to be delivered to a prominent doctor- a woman who is now dead, as is the man who was delivering said pouch- the contents of which have infected an exobiologist with a paralyzing toxin. Yet, what are we stuck on here? The whereabouts of Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You mean its the wrong question.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Several of the men on this committee are lawyers. It is my experience that lawyers ask the wrong question only when they don’t want the right answer.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Unless Agent Mulder has already found the answers they’re looking for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or someone wants to make sure that he doesn’t find out.

speaker: SKINNER
line: These are congressmen we’re talking about, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that, sir. And it is my natural inclination to believe that they are acting in the best interest of the truth...but I am not inclined to follow my own judgement in this case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You’re going to follow Agent Mulder’s? Is that it?

speaker: CSM
line: His name is Vassily Peskow. He was a KGB line-X stringer working out of Moscow center.

speaker: WMM
line: But how could this be? How could the Russians know we were working on our own inoculation? Six of us knew!

speaker: CSM
line: Dr. Charne-Sayre?

speaker: WMM
line: She was trusted...absolutely!

speaker: CSM
line: Then I don’t know.

speaker: WMM
line: Find this man! Find him!

speaker: CSM
line: If my intelligence sources are right...I think there’s someone who might save us the trouble.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Mr. Chairman, may I? Agent Scully...you’ve had a good long time to think about the question that was asked in our last session. I want to give you the opportunity to answer that question here, today. So I can help our good chairman here to get on with this proceeding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can’t answer that question, sir.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: I’m going to ask you again. Where is Special Agent Mulder? Why is he not here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d be happy to answer you questions about the man carrying the diplomatic pouch...

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: ...about his murder, and my opinion about its connection to the death of Dr. Bonita Charne-Sayre of the World Health Organization...

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Miss Scully....you’ll get your chance with all of that...

speaker: SCULLY
line: or about the biotoxin being transported within that pouch.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Answer the question Miss Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is the question?

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: All right. Let’s come to order. Agent Scully...do continue.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir. If I may I’d like to finish making my point.

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: What is your point, Miss Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That the death of Doctor Charne-Sayre, given her field of expertise, not only suggests that she knew something about the toxin, but also its origins, and that knowledge may be directly linked to the man in Assistant Director Skinner’s apartment building

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Miss Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir...uh...Assistant Director Skinner has just informed me that there has been an accident directly related...

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: An accident...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A doctor, infected with the toxin, has died under suspicious circumstances involving a theft of evidence...of the contents of the diplomatic pouch...

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: Well, we’ve gotten off to a real fine start here. I’m going to recess now until this new matter can be explained. So that we might then begin to move in a forward direction.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder....

speaker: MULDER
line: I get to put my arms around you...both of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When did you get back here?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s been a long, strange trip.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Some other time. I think there’s been enough strangeness here to sort through.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I’ve made several connections about this toxin- about what it might be...

speaker: MULDER
line: So have I.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir? I need your permission to book two airfares to Boca Raton, Florida. It shouldn’t take more than twelve...fifteen hours...but in the even that it does, I need you to stall the committee tomorrow, for the purpose of...

speaker: SKINNER
line: If you explain it to me, Agent Scully, I’m going to have to explain it to them. I suggest you do everything in your power to make it back for tomorrows session...or I can’t help you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Boca Raton?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bonita Charne-Sayre is a board member and a chief physician for a chain if elder-care convalescent hospitals across the country....guess what one of her patients died of in Boca Raton?

speaker: AT THE CONVALESCENT HOME, 9
line: 32 PM.

speaker: NURSE
line: Yes. What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agents Mulder and Scully. We need your permission to come onto the premises and speak with you or any of your patients.

speaker: NURSE
line: What about?

speaker: MULDER
line: May we come in?

speaker: NURSE
line: Well, yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When was the last time these patients were checked.

speaker: NURSE
line: An hour ago, at bed check.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This man is dead.

speaker: NURSE
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. These people are test subjects. They’ve all been poisoned.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who gave these patients their meds tonight?

speaker: NURSE
line: I did.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, I need you to call 911. Tell them you have an emergency quarantine of a biohazardous material. I need you to show us all of the entrances of the hospital. We’ve got to seal this building immediately. .

speaker: SCULLY
line: I do not understand what it is you hope to learn here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Everything that’s happened....every death we’ve seen can be traced back to one man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But according to you that man is in Russia...possibly even dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he isn’t working alone.. Terry Edward Mayhew. Can we talk with you...have a little off the record chat?

speaker: MAYHEW
line: About?

speaker: MULDER
line: Alex Krycek.

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: The man who set you up....you and the members of your militia.

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Name wasn’t Krycek. It was Arntzen, or something like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: You came into contact with him in North Dakota salvaging materials from a missile silo.

speaker: MAYHEW
line: I ain’t never been in no missile silo. I don’t know nothing about that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This man Krycek, or “Arntzen” as you call him...How did he come into contact with you?...off the record.

speaker: MAYHEW
line: He came to us...with some building materials and big ideas.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was he looking to build?

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Two....”devices”.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he ever mention Black Cancer.

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Oh yeah!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did he say?

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Developed by the Soviets. Saddam used it in the Gulf.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean...used as bio-warfare?

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Why do you think they made them servicemen take all them pills? U.S. Government knew about the Black Cancer. They lied. Didn’t have no cure...no inoculation.....I think we’ll quit right there. I got nothing more to say.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let’s go Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a second. You said there were...uh..two devices. What happened to the other bomb?

speaker: MAYHEW
line: I ate it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: You want to know about anarchy? You don’t tell me where that other bomb is and I’ll make sure you spend your prison time on your bigoted hands and knees putting a big smile on some convict’s face.

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Sonofabitch stole it- truck and all. Some storage garage.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where?

speaker: MAYHEW
line: Terma...North Dakota.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank You. Scully, get on the phone and get the license numbers for any two-ton trucks stolen in North Dakota in the last six months. Then call Canadian border authorities and have them stop any truck fitting that description. Tell them they’re looking for a bomb.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: This has been a big setup from the beginning- almost perfectly executed. Someone used Krycek, then Krycek used us...someone who didn’t want that rock in American hands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But what’s in Canada?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where would you put this rock if you didn’t want it to be found?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Back in the ground.

speaker: PESKOW
line: Fertilizer for my hothouse tomatoes. Beautiful tomatoes, all year, eh? Thanks..

speaker: MULDER
line: Go back to the refinery. See if you can find anybody who knows anything about that truck.

line: I would just as soon kill you, but please, don’t make me. My work is done. Sur Posidive. .

line: Mulder! .

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: I’d like to get started here. Miss Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes...I’m ready here, sir.

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: You have evidence to present. At least, that’s what I’ve been told.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, Senator...evidence linking a number of deaths... a great number...to a biotoxin that was transported to US soil by a courier who was also killed.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Is this the same man who was pushed from the Assistant Director’s apartment?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. He has not been ID’ed.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Do we have the name of the individual who pushed him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir. Alex Krycek...who is missing and, possibly , deceased.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: And are you then in possession of the pouch or its contents?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No sir.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: What evidence are you then presenting us with today?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Documents and interviews in support of a wide-ranging conspiracy to control a lethal bio-toxin that is, in fact, extra-terrestrial in origin.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: Well...uh....what are we talking about...?Little green men, here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. Not at all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is this so hard to believe? When the accepted discovery of life off this planet is on the front page of every newspaper around the world? When the most conservative scientists and science journals are calling for the exploration of Mars and Jupiter? With every reason to believe that life and the persistence of it is thriving outside our own terrestrial sphere? If you cannot get past this, then I suggest this whole committee be held in contempt, for ignoring evidence that cannot be refuted.

speaker: SENATOR SORENSON
line: This is NOT why we are here today.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then why are we here today?!?

speaker: MR. ROMINE
line: I will suggest that we recess here until such a time that all the evidence can be properly evaluated.. .
